pages.text: The most basic power available to a druid is spellcraft. To make, each spell requires specific components, which are broken down in a $(l:apparatus/mortar)Mortar & Pestle$() into spell dust. This dust can then be imbued into a staff.$(p)In addition to the creation, casting spells require material components in the form of herbs.

Once the spell dust has been crafted, it is imbued into the staff with an Imbuer. During the process, further reagents can be added to permanently modify the spell.$(p)Imbuement will never override a old spell slot, instead placing the new spell in the first available empty slot, if there is one.$(p)Place both staff and spell dust into the imbuer to begin the process.

pages.title: Imbuer
pages.text: It will take a short amount of time before the staff is returned, with the new spell ready for use.$(p)Spell dust $(info) $(l:basics/spells#augmentation)can be augmented with other reagents before$() being imbued into the staff.

pages.title: Staff
pages.text: The staff can be made from any wood, as the wildroot allows the imbued spells to activate freely. In addition, herbs must also be provided from $(l:apparatus/component_pouch)a suitable container$().$(p)$(info) You may craft larger containers in the future.

pages.title: Augmentation
pages.text: It is possible to augment some spells by placing their dusts in the imbuer without the stuff, and then apply one of the reagents specified in the entry for that spell.$(p)After this is done, the dust may be imbued as usual.$(p)$(info) Not all spells accept modifiers.

pages.title: Manipulating the Staff
pages.text: The staff is capable of holding up to 5 spells. The currently selected spell is always displayed in the tooltip, while holding shift will allow show all imbued spells.$(p)Sneaking while right-clicking will cycle through to the next available spells.$(p)Additional key-binds exist, should you need them.

pages.title: Casting
pages.text: One selected, the staff mey be held in either hand.$(p)If the spell is instantaneous, simply right-click to activate. Otherwise, requires your concentration: hold right-click for as long as you wish to activate it.$(p)If the correct components are available, they will be consumed, the spell cast, and a visual alert will show you your remaining stock of herbs.

pages.title: Removing Spells
pages.text: As the power of the staff is limited and can only maintain 5 spells, it may become necessary for you to remove a spell.$(p)Simply select the spell you wish to void, and then $(info) imbue the staff with $(l:resources/runic_dust)Runic Dust$().$(p)The staff returned will have an empty slot where the spell once was.
